intro: Xylopleurum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy xylopleurum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Xylopleurum hirsutum is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
